intro: Sphaeranthus setulosus, commonly known as the roughhead tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils, and it produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Its leaves are narrow, hairy, and often have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Sphaeranthus setulosus is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
